intro: Scheeria panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian scheeria, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Panama. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white to pale pink flowers and elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Scheeria panamensis typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as montane forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
